body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

6ba34e21fee2a81677e8261dfeaf24c8cd320500

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

Debian Sid

### Terminal name/version

Kitty 0.26.5-2, XTerm 377-1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty for kitty, xterm-256color for xterm

### Installation

from source

### How to reproduce the issue

Having `~/tmp/noice-min.lua` (from https://github.com/folke/noice.nvim/wiki/Minimal-%60init.lua%60-to-Reproduce-an-Issue + modifications) with
```lua
local root = vim.fn.fnamemodify("./.repro", ":p")

-- set stdpaths to use .repro
for _, name in ipairs({ "config", "data", "state", "cache" }) do
  vim.env[("XDG_%s_HOME"):format(name:upper())] = root .. "/" .. name
end

-- bootstrap lazy
local lazypath = root .. "/plugins/lazy.nvim"
if not vim.loop.fs_stat(lazypath) then
  vim.fn.system({
    "git",
    "clone",
    "--filter=blob:none",
    "--single-branch",
    "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git",
    lazypath,
  })
end
vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(lazypath)

-- install plugins
local plugins = {
  "folke/tokyonight.nvim",
  {
    "folke/noice.nvim",
    dependencies = {
      "MunifTanjim/nui.nvim",
      "rcarriga/nvim-notify",
    },
  },
}
require("lazy").setup(plugins, {
  root = root .. "/plugins",
})

-- add anything else here
vim.opt.termguicolors = true
vim.cmd([[colorscheme tokyonight]])
require("noice").setup({
  messages = {
    view = 'mini',
    view_search = false,
    view_error = 'mini',
    view_warn = 'mini',
  },
  notify = {
    enabled = true,
    view = 'mini',
  },
  lsp = {
    signature = {
      enabled = false,
    },
    hover = {
      enabled = false,
    }
  },
  views = {
    mini = {
      timeout = 5000,
    },
  },
})

vim.keymap.set('c', '<C-x>', function()
  require('noice').redirect(vim.fn.getcmdline())
  vim.api.nvim_input('<esc>')
end, { desc = 'Redirect Cmdline' })
```
`local.mk` used to build with 
```makefile
CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo
CMAKE_EXTRA_FLAGS="-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=${HOME}/tmp/nvim-from-src"
CMAKE_EXTRA_FLAGS += -DENABLE_LIBINTL=OFF
```
run 
```
~/tmp/nvim-from-src/bin/nvim -u ~/tmp/noice-min.lua
```
type `:version` and submit with `C-x`. 

### Expected behavior

Nvim does not crash.

### Actual behavior

Nvim crashes without message on xterm and kitty, works as expected with nvim-qt.

Hmm, I can reproduce this crash with neovim-qt as well.
Yes. root cause is not related to TUI (but internal inconsistency of ext_messages memory handling)

This can simply be reproduced by:
```lua
local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('foo')
local opts = {ext_messages = true, ext_cmdline = true}
vim.ui_attach(ns, opts, function()
  vim.cmd('redraw')
end)
vim.cmd('version')
```
Would be very nice to have a fix for this because I think that this makes it impossible to do `diB` for example.

On `v0.9.0-dev-619+gc889f7543 ` I get crash with
```
src/nvim/rbuffer.c:144: rbuffer_consumed: Assertion `count && count <= buf->size' failed.
```

Now, this script
```lua
local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('foo')
local opts = {ext_messages = true, ext_cmdline = true}
vim.ui_attach(ns, opts, function()
  vim.cmd('redraw')
end)
vim.cmd('version')
```
- Crashes with ``src/nvim/rbuffer.c:144: rbuffer_consumed: Assertion `count && count <= buf->size' failed`` with TUI
- Gives a lot of `Received unexpected redraw arguments, expecting list QVariant(QByteArray, "redraw")` with nvim-qt
- With ASAN the heap-use-after-free still happens

fyi: these segfaults are now fixed by a work-around in Noice. The `vim.ui_attach` handler now returns `true` for **TUI**.

https://github.com/folke/noice.nvim/commit/176ec31026ec4baf64638fba1a180701257380f1
It's still reproducible after recent UI fixes.
